tool.name: SAGA.shapes_polygons.20
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayINPUT False isArrayPOINTS False isArrayFIELDS False output_data_OUTPUT $output_data_OUTPUT name SAGA.shapes_polygons.20 INPUT $INPUT POINTS $POINTS FIELDS $FIELDS ADD_LOCATION_INFO $ADD_LOCATION_INFO prefer $prefer response $response outputType_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.outputType_OUTPUT transmissionMode_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.transmissionMode_OUTPUT

param.name: INPUT
param.label: Polygons
param.help: Input polygon shapefile The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json

param.name: POINTS
param.label: Points
param.help: Input point shapefile The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: Attributes
param.help: Attributes to add. Select none to add all The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_OUTPUT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_OUTPUT
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Spatial join for polygons. Retrieves for each polygon the selected attributes from that point, which is contained in the polygon. In case a polygon contains more than one point, the last point wins.<br/>Optionally, the tool allows one to attach the geometrical properties (x,y(z,m)) of each point as additional attributes.<br/><br/>
